course.subject: ISDN
course.name: Materials for Physical Prototyping
course.description: The special topic course introduces the most common used materials for physical prototyping and year-long projects. This course includes fundamental theory and practical hands-on labs and projects for the student to acquire the basic knowledge on the materials for prototyping, including metal, polymer, glass, wood, and others. Some advanced materials for future projects will also be covered, such as metal thin film, liquid metal, graphene, etc. The properties of the materials will also be tested and measured during the labs. The students will acquire the knowledge through lectures, and practical hands-on labs. Instructorâ€™s approval is required.
